title: EU agrees new sanctions on Russia; UK sees record demand for long-term debt - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: markets end higher despite eu sanctions .
us consumer confidence jumps to best level since 2007
uk sees record demand for ultra long-term bond .
next hikes profit forecasts after strong sales .
ruble hits two-month low as sanctions loom .
vodafone chairman attacks european regulation at agm .
bp : russian sanctions could hurt us .

text: of course , the eu sanctions on russia is not the end of it : peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) as per usual w/ # eu decisions on # russia , we 're hearing the @ twitterid is expected to announce their own sanctions later today holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) white house : u.s. could impose new sanctions on # russia 'as soon as today ' on that note , it 's time to shut up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments and we 'll be back tomorrow .

documents.title: markets end higher despite eu sanctions
text: european markets came off their best levels as news that the european union had agreed sanctions against russia over ukraine began to filter through .
but they still managed to end the day in poslitive territory , with some good corporate results from the likes of gkn in the uk and pfizer in the us helping sentiment .

the closing scores showed : the ftse 100 finished 19.68 points or 0.29 % higher at 6807.75 germany 's dax rose 0.58 % at 9653.63 france 's cac closed 0.48 % better at 4365.58 italy 's ftse mib added 0.7 % to 21085.12 spain 's ibex ended 0.2 % higher at 10901.2 in the us , the dow jones industrial average is uncertain which way to turn , alternating between positive and negative territory .
at the moment it is up 23 points or 0.14 % .

here 's a flavour of our story on the eu sanctions on russia : european union governments reached a deal on tuesday to impose economic sanctions against russia , targeting its oil industry , defence , dual-use goods and sensitive technologies .
the sanctions will be reviewed after three months , a diplomat said .
details of the eu sanctions are still to come but could also include a ban on the country 's biggest state-owned banks from selling stock or long-term debt on european markets .
the dutch foreign minister , frans timmermans , said on tuesday that sanctions under consideration on russian capital markets would have a far-reaching and immediate effect '' .

calls for widened sanctions have gained momentum since the shooting down of malaysia airlines flight mh17 over eastern ukraine , which the us and allies have said was was almost certainly shot down by pro-russian separatists using a russian-supplied surface-to-air missile .
russia has denied supplying such a missile .

the us secretary of state , john kerry , said on tuesday there 's been no shred of evidence '' that russia is willing to help end the violence and bloodshed between the ukraine separatists backed by moscow and the government in kiev and reiterated further us sanctions could come .
in a timely report given the latest eu sanctions on russia , the imf says the growing tensions over ukraine could undermine financial markets in europe and beyond .
it also warns of the effect of rising interest rates .

my colleague katie allen writes : rising interest rates in advanced economies and a slowdown in emerging markets could combine to cut global growth by as much as 2 % , the international monetary fund has warned .

its latest report into how policy moves in one country can spill over into others also highlights the threat that tensions in russia and ukraine could send shockwaves through financial and commodity markets across europe , central asia and beyond .
the imf 's main concerns , however , centre around two key factors emerging as the global economy shifts from crisis to recovery mode '' .
it highlights the challenge for central banks of smoothly unwinding the ultraloose monetary policy they brought in to support advanced economies during the financial crisis .
secondly , it warns that emerging market economies are slowing in a synchronised and protracted manner '' and that poses risks to the rest of the world in terms of trade and finance .
the report is the latest to emphasise the complex task of returning to more normal interest rates after years of extraordinary measures to shore up markets and confidence .
in the uk , base rates have been at a record low of 0.5 % for more than five years while in both the us and uk there have been vast money printing schemes , known as quantitative easing .
a full statement on eu sanctions against russia is expected tomorrow , although some further details are expected to emerge before then .
but some seem to feel they do n't go far enough : binyamin appelbaum ( @ bcappelbaum ) if the eu really wanted to punish russia , they would make it join the eurozone .

more snippets on the sanctions : business insider ( @ businessinsider ) diplomats : eu governments are going after russian banks over ukraine manfred weber ( @ manfredweber ) new sanctions on # russia : @ twitterid backs @ twitterid .
russia has to cooperate in the ukraine crisis and put pressure on separatists .
james kanter ( @ jameskanter ) eu sanctions to restrict sales of technologies to russia for deep water , arctic and shale oil activities .
natural gas unaffected .
# mh17 lemasabachthani ( @ lemasabachthani ) kerry : u.s. will impose wider sanctions on russia if no change maxime sbaihi ( @ mxsba ) eu announces new sanctions against russian .
now watch for possible retaliation .
here the most exposed banking sectors

breaking news on russian sanctions which have just been agreed by the european union : fabrizio goria ( @ fgoria ) eu sanctions against russia to include oil sector , dual-use goods , defence , sensitive technology ; to be reviewed after 3 months- rtrs holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) # russia ruble erases part of the losses after eu govts reached deal to impose econ sanctions .
now at 35.68 .
dual use goods , by the way , according to the european commission are `` goods , software and technology normally used for civilian purposes but which may have military applications , . ''
the positive us confidence data - along with positive results from pfizer and merck - has helped the dow jones industrial average climb 66 points or 0.39 % .

documents.title: us consumer confidence jumps to best level since 2007
text: in contrast to the weaker than expected us housing figures earlier and despite the growing geopolitical tensions , the country 's consumers appear in confident mood .
according to the conference board index , an industry group , consumer confidence jumped to 90.9 in july , up from a revised 86.4 the previous month and better than the 85.3 expected .
this is the highest monthly level since october 2007 , before the financial crisis struck .
it comes ahead of a raft of us economic data this week , including gdp and non-farm payrolls and - crucially - the result of the latest federal reserve meeting tomorrow .
the fed is expected to trim its bond buying programme by $ 10m a month once more , but strong data puts more pressure on the central bank to think about raising interest rates .
james knightley at ing bank said : june 's figure was also revised higher so we now have a really strong upward trend in place .
importantly , the bulk of the improvement was in the expectations component .

the 92.7 reading for this component has historically been consistent with real consumer spending growth of close to 3 % year on year versus the current rate of 1.9 % , thereby offering hope that the us growth story can gain more momentum in the second half of 2014 .

in any case , we expect tomorrow 's second quarter gdp number to come in on the strong side of market expectations and look for friday 's payrolls number to be firm too ( with the possibility of a sub-6 % unemployment rate figure ) .
such an outcome would put pressure on the federal reserve to shift the balance of their language while bringing forward market expectations for the first fed rate hike - we are predicting april .
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) us consumer confidence surges to highest since oct 2007 .
surely it wo n't prove to be as hopelessly misplaced this time around .

documents.title: uk sees record demand for ultra long-term bond
text: britain saw record strong demand for a sale of long-term , inflation-linked , government debt today .
the debt management office ( which handles uk sovereign bond sales ) auctioned off £ 5bn of a new index-linked bond that matures in 44 years time , in 2058 .
and £ 14bn of orders flooded in - a record , according to jo whelan , the dmo 's deputy ceo .
this strong demand meant the dmo was able to price the bond at a 'negative real yield ' , or interest rate after inflation , of minus 0.053 % .
that means buyers will receive a return of just below the uk inflation rate , another record .

whelan said : with this very strong support from the market we are pleased to have been able to launch the new gilt in substantial size and at a negative real yield for the first time in a dmo index-linked gilt syndication .
it 's a sign that british debt remains popular in the markets , especially with investors such as pension funds who need to hold long-term assets to balance their long-term liabilities .
jamie searle , a uk rates strategist at citigroup , told bloomberg that the auction attracted more interest than expected .
that together with the size of the order book and the speed with which it was built suggest that demand was strong .
the trend of pension fund de-risking remains firmly in place and a 2058 maturity is likely to appeal to liability-driven investment accounts in particular . ''
sam hill of rbc capital markets agreed : a large part of the demand comes from return-insensitive pension funds .
they remain fairly skewed towards minimising risks and inflation is a big part of that .
( quote via fastft ) most of the orders came from british institutions , according to the dmo .
it has now raised its target for ultra-long index-linked bond sales this year to £ 9bn , from £ 8.5bn .
the auction came as other safe-haven european bonds saw strong demand .
german borrowing costs hit new record lows today , with the yield ( or interest rate ) on 10-year bunds dropping to 1.12 % , from 1.14 % yesterday , in the bond market .
that is lower than during the eurozone crisis .

german 10-year bund yields , 2004-2014 reuters traders said bunds prices ( which move inversely to yields ) were being pushed up by fears of slow growth and deflation in europe , and the possibility that the ecb will launch a quantitative easing programme .
( and with that , i 'm handing over to nick fletcher .
cheers , gw )

bloomberg 's reporting that hundreds of it jobs worker at jp morgan are being 'let go ' : bloomberg news ( @ bloombergnews ) breaking : jpmorgan said to cut hundreds of tech staff at investment bank :

documents.title: us house prices miss forecasts
text: the us housing market appears to have lost some oomph , which came as something of a surprise to wall street analysts .
the s & p/case-shiller home price index survey showed that prices rose by 9.4 % annually in may , compared to 10.8 % in the year to april .
prices rose 1.1 % month-on-month , but actually fell by 0.3 % in inflation-adjusted terms .

david blitzer , of s & p dow jones indices , said the us housing sector has been `` turning in mixed economic numbers '' in recent months : `` prices and sales of existing homes have shown improvement while construction and sales of new homes continue to lag . ''
christine lagarde has urged ukraine to push on with the measures agreed with the international monetary fund , as part of its support programme .
the imf chief held meetings in ukraine today , with central bank governor valerya gontareva and foreign minister pavlo klimkin .

an imf spokesperson explains : the discussion focused on the recent political developments in ukraine and the authorities ' efforts to implement the economic reform program supported by a stand-by arrangement with the fund .

the managing director encouraged steady implementation of the authorities ' reforms , including the policy package needed for completion of the first review under the program supported by the imf . ''
the imf has approved a $ 17bn bailout for ukraine , but there are concerns that more will be needed , given its economic deterioration since the crisis with russia began .

documents.title: no revolt at vodafone
text: the shareholder criticism is over , and now it 's time for the votes .
and vodafone 's key resolutions on its pay policies and long-term incentive plans have all been approved with high majorities .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) vodafone rem policy approved by 95.97pc , incentive plan 95.39pc , rem report 97pc

documents.title: vodafone faces questions over surveillance
text: vodafone is now being challenged over its role in allowing governments to snoop on its citizens .
peter micek of access , an organisation that defends digital rights , urged vodafone to support its work fighting surveillance and changing laws that allow governments to access our communications .

he also asked them how they will stop 'warrantless snooping ' shareaction ( @ shareactionuk ) peter from @ twitterid asking vodafone about surveillance # vodafoneagm juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) access rep peter micek : will vodafone support reforming ripa , end secret warrants and bulk surveillance ?
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) access : how does vodafone plan to stop warrantless snooping on its network ( this happens in at least 6 countries ) .
important questions .
in reply , vodafone chairman gerard kleisterlee said the company was in active discussions with the uk government over its proposed changes to the regulation of investigatory powers act ( ripa ) .
kleisterlee also insisted that vodafone takes its customers ' privacy seriously , and wants to protect it .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) chair : will engaged with uk govt on ripa review .
we are v much focussed on protecting the rights of our custmrs and protecting thr privacy .
experts are already worried , though , that the changes being made to ripa are being rushed through parliament too quickly .
more details here .

more applause at vodafone , after a shareholder demands that luc vandevelde should be ejected from the firm 's remuneration committee ( as explained earlier , he 's been helping to set pay rates for a decade ) .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) a shareholder claiming to rep 4m shares and the german nation : i am in favour of removing mr vandevelde .
claps and cheers from the floor .

vodafone 's chief executive , vittorio colao , has been told that his bonus is unacceptable : juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) shareholder says there should be a vote on any ceo rewards that surpass 200pc of salary .
colao 's maximum payout is 245pc .

documents.title: vodafone shareholders unhappy about verizon deal
text: vodafone shareholders are now venting their unhappiness over the sale of its stake in verizon back in march .

although shareholders received a slug of cash when vodafone finally sold out to verizon for $ 130bn , they also saw their total vodafone shareholding fall ( down to 6 shares for every 11 they owned before ) .
and they 're now feeling poorer .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) much anger in the room from pensioners who have had their vodafone holding cut in the verizon return of value .
a mood change from last yr. juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) pensioner : losing over half the shares my calculation was i was at a loss .
are you going to increase the dividend by double ?
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) chair : if you hold less shares you will get less dividend .
- technically they are no better or worse off , as vodafone simply swapped its stake in verizon for cash .
let 's see what happens when vodafone announces its dividend for 2015
vodafone was also blasted for allowing luc vandevelde , the former chairman of m & s , to remain on its remuneration committee for more than a decade .
apparently vandevelde should stay because he 's doing a `` great '' job .
shareholders find that quite amusing .
for whom is he doing a great job ?
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) guffaws from the audience as chairman says vandervelde has done a great job .

documents.title: vodafone challenged on pay
text: back at the vodafone agm , and shareholders are applauding after an investor challenged the board over their pay packets .
can they really be justified , given vodafone 's mixed performance , and its disappointing results last week , asks a representative of a london local authority pension fund .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) lapf rep : in view of the not exactly stellar financial perf , do u not consider making exec payments many times existing salary excessive ?
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) the audience claps the question on pay from richard greening of islington council pension fund and lapf .

apparently some of vodafone 's lucrative incentive deals will yield a little less money in future , the chairman replied : juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) kleisterlee : defends exec pay but `` these plans will start to pay out significantly less than they have in recent years . ''

documents.title: ruble hits two-month low as sanctions loom
text: the imminent prospect of tougher sanctions being imposed on russia have driven the ruble down to a two-month low .
one us dollar now buys 35.7 rubles , the most since early may , as the selloff which began yesterday continues .
reuters russia also announced that it has cancelled a government bond auction today - this is a fairly regular occurrence , though .
paul waldie ( @ pwaldieglobe ) russia cancels second ruble bond auction in a row amid threats of more sanctions .
world leader are expected to announce new sanctions later today .
and malcom rifkind , a former uk foreign secretary , has urged them to take a tough line with moscow .

he told the radio 4 's today programme that the measures announced thus far have been `` pretty useless '' : `` if you impose visa controls or asset freezes on 50 or 60 of his cronies , well , i 'm sure they 're very disappointed [ but ] why should putin change his foreign policy ?

`` when you get into the situation of preventing them having access to financial markets , preventing high-quality exports for their energy industry , that goes to the very heart of the russian economy .

`` so this is not about popularity , it 's about economic damage because if putin wants to have - as he does want to have - strong armed forces , a proactive foreign policy , that is expensive and the russian economy is already in a pretty sorry state . ''
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) # russia ruble slide continues as eu finalises ambitious russian sanctions .
now 0.5 % lower vs dollar at 37.69 .
luke springthorpe ( @ l springthorpe ) the russian ruble hits the skids as sanctions begin to bite ( chart=rub/usd )
there do n't appear to be any protests outside the vodafone agm , but tax campaigners has been chivying the mobile giant online .
uk uncut ( @ ukuncut ) .
@ vodafoneuk - have n't paid corp tax in the uk since 2011 .

at 11am tweet telling them what public services that £ could save # vodafoneagm occupy london ( @ occupylondon ) ecuador has increased its public services and grown its economy by simply making tax dodgers like you pay up # vodafoneagm @ twitterid ecuador
vodafone is trying to pacify its shareholders by reminding them how much money they 've had back .
we 've returned £ 123bn to investors in last 10 years , it says , and over £ 80bn in last 4 years .
recent share price performace is n't as rosy , though - down 16 % during 2014 ( although this is complicated by the sale of its verizon stake )

shareaction , the campaign group , are also attending the vodafone agm - they reckon there 's some grumbling in the ranks : shareaction ( @ shareactionuk ) onto the hard numbers now - 'a mixed year ' says the # vodafone chair .
'hopeless ' mutters the s/holder beside me !
# vodafoneagm shareaction ( @ shareactionuk ) judging by the muttering and sarcastic laughter around me , the verizon deal is likely to feature a lot at question time at # vodafoneagm

documents.title: vodafone chairman attacks european regulation at agm
text: vodafone 's chairman has called on europe to stop driving down mobile phone costs , at the start of its annual shareholder meeting in london .
my colleague juliette garside is there , and reports that gerard kleisterlee argued that brussels is threatening long-term investment .
juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) vodafone agm has opened to a packed audience .
chairman gerard kleisterlee talking .

juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) kleisterlee : there is a risk that govt and regulator pursuit of short term benefit for consumer will risk ling term investment juliette garside ( @ juliettegarside ) his opening remarks are a call to the new european commission president to stop cutting the cost of call .
we ca n't expect vodafone to enjoy regulators pushing down its profits , of course - but most consumer groups have welcomed cuts to roaming charges and overseas bills .
matthews/pa in the world of football , chairmen usually hand out the votes of confidence .
but in the city , they can receive them too .
sir ken morrison , the grand old man of uk retail , has just declared that he `` welcomes '' the appointment of andrew higginson as chairman elect of w morrisons this morning .
he 's got good background , good experience higginson has been lured from poundland by the challenge of helping to revitalise the chain that sir ken built .
a former tesco finance director , he left after missing out on the top job there ( bet he 's got over that disappointment , given phil clarke 's troubles ! )
morrison 's needs his help , too .
the latest figures from kantor show that its sales have slumped by 3.8 % in the last 12 weeks .
mind you , so have tesco , as the discount chains gain ground ( more on this shortly )
after a positive start , bp shares have now fallen 0.8 % or 4p to 492p .
the prospect of fresh russian sanctions may be having an effect .

documents.title: our bp story
text: we should n't be surprised that bp is worried about russian sanctions ; its alliance with rosneft has yielded tasty earnings since it was established in 2012 .

my colleague jennifer rankin reports : bp has earned bumper profits from its stake in the kremlin-controlled oil company rosneft since the start of the year , but warned investors that it could be hurt by western sanctions against russia .
the ftse 100 company , which owns one fifth of russia 's largest oil company , made $ 1.6bn ( £ 950m ) from rosneft in the first six months of 2014 , an 80 % increase on last year .
on top of this bp was paid a $ 700m dividend from rosneft in july .
but with the european union poised to announce tougher sanctions against russia , bp acknowledged that its reputation was at stake over its ties with the russian state oil giant .

`` further economic sanctions could adversely impact our business and strategic objectives in russia , the level of our income , production and reserves , our investment in rosneft and our reputation , '' the company said .
here 's her full story : bp warns on russia sanctions despite rosneft profits
analysts at s & p capital like the look of next 's results this morning - they 've raised their price target on its shares to £ 71.00 , from £ 67.00 .
they 're currently changing hands for £ 66.90 , a gain of 2.6 % today .

documents.title: uk mortgage approvals rise
text: expectations that the uk housing market would slow this summer have taken a knock .

mortgage approvals actually rose in june , for the first time in four months , with 67,196 loans being granted.. that suggests that the new affordability tests which were imposed this spring only had a temporary impact on the sector .
rob wood of berenberg bank says housing activity is rising again : as the temporary disruption from tighter regulations passes we expect approvals to return to their upward trend .
with interest rates very low and house building way behind the demand for new homes we look for house prices to gain 10 % in 2014 and 2015 .
and the rest of the country could outpace london there may be further residual effects from the new rules , particularly in london .
while , in our view , the new regulations are a temporary disruption , they could have more long-lasting effects in london where affordability is most stretched .
chris williamson ( @ williamsonchris ) uk mortgage approvals charted since '94 .
june saw 1st rise since january but at 67k still well down on pre-crisis ave

documents.title: boe governor : current account deficit is n't a crisis
text: ben broadbent , deputy governor of the bank of england , has argued today that britain 's swelling current account deficit is n't an `` existential threat '' to britain 's stability .
in a speech in london , broadbent argued that the uk 's `` hard-won policy framework '' means its economic credibility is n't under threat .
he acknowledged that gap between trade , asset income and transfers into britain , and out of the country is at the widest for decades .

uk current account deficit photograph : /bank of england that 's partly because the uk 's is struggling to close the trade gap : it exists partly because the rest of the uk-trade-weighted world , the rest of europe in particular , has n't yet recovered as rapidly .
if the global economy remains sluggish , it will inevitably be harder for an open economy like the uk to achieve both strong and balanced growth .

but , interestingly , the recent deterioration also due to a drop in the income received on the uk 's overseas balance sheet , compared to what foreign investors are getting on their uk assets below .
it 's not just because of the trade gap .
the full speech is here - here are some more charts .
of england of england
smith/alamy one of the most recognisable features of the london skyline is up for sale .
the gherkin skyscraper went on the market this morning , after collapsing into receivership in april .
the lord foster-designed tower could raise £ 640m , with sellers hoping for interest from around the world .
more here : london 's gherkin skyscraper put on the market

documents.title: dark pool news ( 2 ) : ubs says regulators are looking at our system
text: barclays is n't the only bank facing question over its dark pool - financial regulators are taking a closer look at other investment banks ' anonymous trading systems too .

as fastft flagged up this morning , swiss bank ubs has alerted its shareholders that its dark pool is being probed : it said : ubs is responding to inquiries concerning the operation of ubs 's alternative trading system ( ats ) ( also referred to as a dark pool ) and its securities order routing and execution practices from various authorities , including the sec , the new york attorney general and finra , who reportedly are pursuing similar investigations industry-wide .
these inquiries include an sec investigation that began in early 2012 concerning features of ubs 's ats , including certain order types and disclosure practices that were discontinued two years ago .
ubs is cooperating in these matters .

documents.title: dark pool news ( 1 ) : investor sues barclays
text: a new front has opened up over barclay 's controversial dark pool trading system .
a us investor has filed a lawsuit claiming she suffered losses when us authorities launched legal action against barclays last month .
reuters explains : barbara strougo of new york filed a class action lawsuit in new york on monday against barclays and its chief executive antony jenkins and finance director tushar morzaria .
it also names former ceo bob diamond and former finance chief chris lucas as defendants .

strougo claimed she and other buyers of barclays american depositary shares ( ads ) lost money after the attorney general brought a lawsuit against barclays ' `` dark pool '' trading venue on june 25 .
barclays ' london-listed shares fell more than 5 percent the next day , and the ads fell 7.4 percent .
last week , barclays hit back , claiming the attorney general 's claim was without merit .
it 's shares did n't really react , though - much to the disappointment of ms strougo and co , i suspect .
the diplomatic wheels are turning .
germany 's foreign minister tweets that five of the most powerful world leaders agreed ( last night ) that tougher sanctions should be imposed on russia .
germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) in phone call , # merkel # obama # hollande # cameron+ # renzi confirm need for sanctions ag. # russia+for humanitarian truce in # gaza rt @ regsprecher

documents.title: analyst : bp 's russian problem
text: back to bp , which issued that warning about russian sanctions this morning .
financial analyst jasper lawler of cmc markets has published a note explaining why the oil firm is so exposed to russia .

lawler writes : while a lot of its peers do have minority interests in russia through oil prices and strategic partnerships with russian oil companies , bp 's exposure makes it much more susceptible to political headwinds by way of its associations with rosneft [ with a 19.75 % stake ] .

bp 's shares have `` hugely underperformed '' recently , due to vladimir putin 's actions towards ukraine , he explains : bp had actually been the outperformer amongst the oil majors but when russian troops moved in to occupy crimea in february the stock 's relative outperformance peaked and never recovered .

since the us government 's sectoral sanctions against russia including the energy sector in late june ; bp 's underperformance has accelerated , rising only 2 % and hugely underperforming major oil rivals royal dutch shell , exxon mobil and chevron , all up over 9 % in the same period .
from top : chevron , shell , exxon and then bp , against the oil price .
lawler of cmc markets the eu and us could announce new sanctions against russia as early as today .
already , rosneft has been hit by american sanctions which bar it from long-term borrowing from us banks .
that 's likely to hit its earnings - it currently provides around 10 % of bp 's profits .

lawler adds : a rise in oil prices or at least a stabilisation of recent declines should benefit bp 's share price but while russia is being sanctioned by the us and europe and bp maintains its 20 % stake in rosneft , the current trend in prices suggest bp risks continuing to underperform .
hat-tip to andrew clark of the times .
he points out that us pharmaceuticals giant pfizer must reveal how much it spent on its failed takeover bid for britain 's astrazeneca , when it publishes its results later today .

documents.title: domino 's gets football boost , but struggles to tackle germany
text: the football world cup has helped to drive sales up at domino 's pizza .
sales are up by an impressive 11.5 % in the first half of this year , due to better marketing and bundled offers , as well as demand from football fans .
in the uk , it 's recorded double digit like-for-like sales growth for the last nine months .
but , rather like poor old brazil , domino 's is struggling to tackle germany , where sales are down 1.7 % this year .

reuters explains : in germany , where britain 's biggest pizza delivery firm 's much-anticipated expansion plans have been hampered by restructuring costs and weak trading , the firm said conditions continued to prove challenging .

the firm has slowed german expansion while it gets to grips with store formats , overheads and growing sales and said it had yet to transfer all of its poorly-trading own-managed stores there to franchisees - a move domino 's hopes will boost sales .
bp 's shares have inched up by 0.6 % in early trading .
shares in next have jumped 2 % at the start of trading in london , as the city welcomes its upgraded profit forecasts .

documents.title: bp : russian sanctions could hurt us
text: oil giant bp has warned the city this morning that it could suffer if fresh sanctions are imposed on russia .
in its latest results , bp cautioned that it would suffer an `` '' adverse impact '' if western powers hit moscow with fresh economic restrictions - in response to the crisis in ukraine .
bp is closely involved with russia , and owns almost 20 % of rosneft , one of the country 's biggest oil producer .
that relationship looks more fragile in the light of recent events .

as bp spells out in its results today : any future erosion of our relationship with rosneft , or the impact of further economic sanctions , could adversely impact our business and strategic objectives in russia , the level of our income , production and reserves , our investment in rosneft and our reputation .
that warning takes the shine of decent-looking performance from bp .
it has reported a 34 % surge in second-quarter profits , from $ 2.7bn to $ 3.6bn .
chief executive bob dudley ( who was famously thrown out of russia in 2008 ) , declared : this was another successful quarter , delivering both operational progress and robust cash flow .

documents.title: next hikes profit forecasts after strong sales
text: a next store in manchester .
waller/demotix/corbis britain 's consumer recovery has boosted sales and earnings at high street and shopping directory chain next .
the company hiked its profit forecasts by a chunky £ 25m this morning , in the latest sign that shoppers are continuing to spend .

next hammered home its dominance over high street rival marks & spencer , reporting high street sales are up 7.5 % this year , with directory sales ( including online ) surging 16.2 % the company gave some of the credit to this year 's decent weather ( last year 's chills did not encourage customers to splash out on new outfits ) .
but still , it 's a strong performance - also showing that britain 's economic recovery has been pushed along by consumers .
next does caution , though , that growth will slow in the months ahead : our guidance for the next six months is for growth of between 4 % and 10 % .
and here 's the details :

documents.title: next and bp results dominate the morning
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and finance .
busy day of corporate news ahead , with a clutch of major european companies reporting results this morning .
that includes uk retailer next , which is benefitting from the uk recovery , and oil giant bp , in the spotlight over its links to russia .
domino 's pizza is also reporting its results today .
later we get us drugs firm 's pfizer 's results - will it talk about its failed bid for uk pharmaceuticals firm astrazeneca ?
astrazeneca 's site in macclesfield , northwest england .
yates/afp/getty images two major european banks are also reporting today .
ubs has posted a 15 % jump in net profits driven by lower costs , but deutsche bank 's next profits are down by 29 % , due to a fall in revenue .

there could be drama at mobile phone giant vodafone 's agm ( 11am today ; expect tough questions over boardroom pay , and surveillance - after it admitted that governments can listen to all conversation on its network .
and bank of england deputy governor ben broadbent is giving a speech in london this morning ( from 8am ) .
we 'll also be watching greece .
yesterday , the athens government named a new chief for its privatisation agency - the fifth in four years , in a bid to keep its bailout programme on track .
